IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: WRC Pennsylvania Memorial Home provides nursing care for the elderly including skilled nursing care and therapy services, personal care and independent living.
IRS990.MissionDescription: WRC Pennsylvania Memorial Home's mission is to provide choices for generations. Built on a not-for-profit foundation of caring, the organization offers residential and assisted living, home and community-based services, skilled and rehabilitative health care.
IRS990.Description: Nursing care for the elderly including skilled nursing care and therapy services consisting of: McKinley Health Center, a 90-Bed skilled nursing facility; Laurelbrooke Assisted Living, a 50-bed assisted living facility; the Laurels, an 18-unit independent living carriage home community; Highland Oaks, a 54-bed assisted living facility; Edgewood Heights, A 40-bed assisted living facility; and Ridgmont, a 40-bed assisted living facility. WRC and related tax exempt entities provided $643,529 in charity care during the year.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: A portion of WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME's dues to PANPHA and AASHA are used for lobbying for not for profit senior living initiatives.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD ("FASB") INTERPRETATION NO. 48, "ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES - AN INTERPRETATION OF FASB STATEMENT NO. 109" ("FIN 48"). FIN 48 CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITY. MEASUREMENT OF THE TAX UNCERTAINTY OCCURS IF THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD IS MET. THE STANDARD ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON THE DERECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, AND DISCLOSURE. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THE ADOPTION OF FIN 48 DID NOT HAVE A MATERIAL EFFECT ON THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION'S POLICY IS TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST RELATED TO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN INTEREST EXPENSE AND PENALTIES IN OPERATING EXPENESE. THERE WERE NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RECOGNIZED ON THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF OPERATIONS AS A RESULT OF THE ADOPTION OF FIN 48.
TRANSFER OF NET ASSETS FROM AFFILIATES: 1008940.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Sole Member of WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME is WRC Senior Services.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WRC Senior Services elects WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME's board members.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WRC Senior Services has the exclusive power to do each of the following with respect to WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME: 1. Approve all fundamental transactions of the Corporation. 2. Elect all of the directors. 3. Approve all of the officers of the Corporation. 4. Remove at any time and from time to time one or more of the officers and/or directors of the corporation without assigning any cause. 5. Approve all indebtedness and contractual commitments of the Corporation in excess of $5,000 with respect to a single transaction or in excess of $15,000 in the aggregate for any rolling twelve-month period or defeasance of any such indebtedness. 6. Approve all capital and operating budgets of the corporation and amendments thereto. 7. Approve all unbudgeted expenditures of the Corporation in excess of $5,000 with respect to a single transaction or in excess of $15,000 in the aggregate. 8. Approve any and all amendments of the Bylaws of the Corporation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME has A CPA FIRM PREPARE ITS FORM 990. The return is completed in draft form and reviewed by manangement of the organization. The Form 990 is then provided to the board of directors for review before it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME ANNUALLY REQUIRES ITS BOARD MEMBERS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO FILL OUT A CONFLICTS OF INTEREST FORM. DURING BOARD MEETINGS, IF AN INTERESTED PARTY HAS A CONFLICT, HE OR SHE RECUSES THEMSELVES FROM VOTING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME's board of directors annually reviews and approves the compensation of their organization's top management.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME MAKES ITS FORM 990 and form 1023 available TO THE PUBLIC upon request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: At this time, WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME does not make its governing documents, conflicts of interest policy and financial statements available to the general public.
WRC PENNSYLVANIA MEMORIAL HOME has an audit committee that is responsible for the oversight of the audit and selection of the independent auditors. The process has not changed from prior year.

FRANCES R. KUHNS and SUSAN SCHMADER split their time between WRC Senior Services, WRC Elk-Forest Senior Health & Housing Services, WRC Health Care Support Services, WRC North Fork Heights, WRC Pennsylvania Memorial Home, and WRC Personal Care Services. Breakdown of Hours Per Week Devoted to each Entity: FRANCES R. KUHNS WRC Senior Services - 1 hour WRC Health Care Support Services - 3 hours WRC North Fork Heights - 1 hour WRC Pennsylvania Memorial Home - 35 hours SUSAN SCHMADER WRC Senior Services - 1 hour WRC Health Care Support Services - 3 hours WRC North Fork Heights - 1 hour WRC Pennsylvania Memorial Home - 35 hours
WRC Pennsylvania Memorial Home also does business as Dr. Arthur Clifton McKinley Health Center, The Laurels Lifestyle in Full Bloom, Highland Oaks, Edgewood Heights, and Ridgmont.
Return is amended due to adjustment in final audited financial statement.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: WRC Elk-Forest Senior Health & Housing Services
